newsitem.title: FRANCE: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde Oct 22.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde Oct 22.

text.p: These are leading stories in afternoon daily Le Monde.

-- Paris court suspends senior police officer for refusing to help a judge investigating alleged official corruption during Jacques Chirac's term as Paris mayor. The move sparks crisis in relations police and justice authorities.

-- Telephone operators in France, Germany, Italy and Spain are to be listed on their country's stock exchange between November 1996 and April 1997. They are seeking to raise a total of 120 billion francs.
-- State-owned shipping company Compagnie Generale Maritime to be sold to Compagnie Maritime d'Affretement through private placement.
-- Bank of France cut call money on Monday.
